page.title: 08BOLD HEATH RIDING SCHOOL.
page.content: We interviewed a girl who worked at Bold Heath Riding School.The stable is half farm and half riding school.They have 32 horses and they are groomed everyday.The oldest horse is 28 and the youngest horse is 6.They have other animals such as cats,dogs,ducks and peacocks. It has been open for 15-16 years. Shows are often held and lessons are very busy. It costs about Â£4 for half an hour and Â£8 for 1 hour.They also give rides to young and disabled children.9 people live on the farm and Mrs. Baker owns the farm. This riding school is the only one of it's type in the area and people come from St. Helens, Widnes and Warrington. The standard of tuition offered is high and the school caters for advanced riding to competition level.
